textList.name: TEXT_START_AEA_ACID
textList.text: The Acidic Growth is a relatively unknown faction. However, what isn't unknown is how dangerous it is.
This nebula is home to the Acidic Growth. It's still unknown whether it's a singular almost omnipresent entity or a hive mind of sorts, but you probably don't wanna be on their bad side.
You're told the Acidic Growth has expanded into this nebula. Unfortunately, only the orchids are welcome in Acidic space.
Not much is known about how the Acidic Growth lives and spends its time. Perhaps you'll find out. Question is, if you'll be lucky enough to survive and tell the tale.

The Acidic Growth formed within a nebula like this. Although able to survive naked in the nebula, the Acidic Growth has created its own ships and technology in order to interact with the wider universe.

event.text: You're hailed by an Acidic vessel. "You, outsider. Your intentions, we do not know. Potential threat to Acidic Growth. Proof, you're not? Otherwise, extermination."
You mute the ship and prepare for combat.

choice.text: Convince it you only have good intentions.

event.name: NEBULA_TRANSPORT_AEA_ACID_LOOT

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: This beacon hosts an Acidic transport. It's safe to bet the ship is most likely carrying some special tech. If you can kill the acidic growth onboard, the cargo will be yours.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of the goods.

event.text: You prepare to secure the cargo by force.
The ship stays outside your weapons range, and eventually jumps away.

event.name: TRANSPORT_CAPTURE_AEA_ACID
event.text: The crew is dead, leaving you with the ship. Its cargo is yours for the taking. Aboard is the special tech you expected, which you bring back to your ship.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_AEA_ACID
textList.text: As the wreck drifts apart you can just about make out the drifting clouds of gas formally making up the Acidic Growth.
As the wreck breaks apart you wonder if the scattered fragments of the Acidic Growth will ever make it back to their nebulas.
You wonder how long it takes a formless cloud of gas to construct a spaceship. If the Acidic Growth could be angry, it would probably be angry with you right now.
Another Acidic vessel destroyed, and another piece of the Acidic Growth stranded.
Someday the Acidic Growth may reach out to form an alliance with the Federation, you'll just have to hope it forgets about all the ships you've destroyed.
You can't help but feel sorry for those you've killed, even if they may or may not be alive.

event.name: DESTROYED_AEA_ACID_ACIDGUN
event.text: To your surprise, one of the natively built Acidic weapons survived the explosion. It's a little crisp from the explosion but with a few repairs you can salvage it.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_AEA_ACID
textList.text: You wonder if the Acidic Growth will know of the slaughter you've committed here. Either way, this wreck is still full of scrap.
Now that Acidic Growth's crew are but fragments diffused about the ship, you get to scrapping.
You thought you would become numb to the guilt after enough murders, but you have yet to experience this.
The Acidic ship has been rid of crew. The moral part of you hopes that killing an Acidic soldier doesn't count as murder.
You reassure yourself that the crew of this ship can feel neither pain nor fear as you strip their vessel of anything useful.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_AEA_ACID_ACIDGUN
event.text: Now emptied of crew, you find one of the natively built Acidic weapons on board. You take it back with you before scrapping the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_ESCAPE_AEA_ACID
textList.text: The Acidic ship powers up its engines and swerves away from you. It's trying to escape!
You detect high spikes in engine power on the Acidic ship. It's trying to escape.

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_AEA_ACID
textList.text: The Acidic ship escapes. To be honest, you're a little glad, hopefully in the future the Acidic Growth won't try to obliterate you either.
The Acidic ship jumps away. You pickup some residue gas clouds in the area, you wonder if there are any fragments of the acidic growth out there.
The Acidic ship's engine power spikes even higher and the ship jumps away.

event.name: GOTAWAY_AEA_ACID_REMAINS
event.text: As the Acidic ship jumps away you notice a trail of scrap left behind from the broken ship. At least you'll have something to scrap.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_AEA_ACID
textList.text: A monotone voice requests you to stop firing in return for some supplies.
The Acidic ship surrenders. They offer some supplies if you'll let it live.
"The offer is satisfactory. Please accept it."
"Stop firing. You will receive reward." It appears the ship is surrendering.

event.name: AEA_ACID_TEST_FIGHT
event.text: TEST.

surrender.text: The station desperately hails you. "Alright, alright! We'll release the Growth. Just stop firing!"

event.text: The Orchid sighs. "Damn it all... Oh, demotion, here I go..."

While the Orchid station transports all the tanks of Growth back to the Acidic ship, the latter contacts you again. "Outsider, gratitude. Orchids - allies. You - ally. Future negotiation, with allies, possible. Accept this." Acidic Soldiers carry over a large amount of scrap.
You continue firing on the station. The Growth will probably be fine, but those Orchids deserve it.

destroyed.text: The station explodes, sending Acidic gases everywhere! You try to fly away, but still get caught up in it; thankfully, the damage is not severe.

event.text: The Growth doesn't seem pleased - if not by tone, at least by words. "Outsider. Orchids, allies, gone? You, not an ally." They cut comms. At least you can salvage the station's wreck.

deadCrew.text: The Orchids are dead, and the station is left empty - only containing tanks with Acidic Growth inside. You scrap what you can.

event.text: The Growth doesn't seem pleased - if not by tone, at least by words. "Outsider. Orchids, allies, gone? You, not an ally." They cut comms. Nothing to do but move on.

surrender.text: You receive a hail from the Coalition ship amidst the battle. "Idiot! Do not dessstroy it!"

destroyed.text: Seeing as you destroyed your target, Acidic ships jump away, and the RUES captain is furious. "You moron! You cossst me my promotion! Do you even know how much paperwork I'll have to do? I hate paper! Why are we still using it?!" They jump away, too, leaving you with a wreck. Scrapping it is.

deadCrew.text: Seeing as your target is neutralized, Acidic ships jump away, and the RUES captain is pleased."Great! Great. I'll contact othersss now to come collect. Your payment, of courssse... And, now that i think of it, could you take me with you? I'd hate doing paperwork after all that. Why do we even ussse paper? Ssstill? I hate paper."

event.text: "Wonderfull. I hope thisss doesssn't count asss dessserting..." The black-clothed Slug comes aboard. You prepare to jump.
"Ah damn. Well, sssee you never." You prepare to jump.

destroyed.text: The Acidic ship breaks apart and you salvage what you can.

event.text: The refugee ship claims they didn't realize this was territory belonging to the Acidic Growth. As a gesture of good will (and seeing how effectively you dispatched the enemy ship), they offer up what supplies they can spare.

deadCrew.text: The Acidic ship, now out of control of the Acidic Growth, provides easy salvage.

event.text: The refugee ship claims they didn't realize this was territory belonging to the Acidic Growth. As a gesture of good will (and seeing how effectively you dispatched the enemy ship), they offer up what supplies they can spare.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead you begin to salvage the ship, However you arrive in a strange room, it appears to be some kind of nursery... Are those Orchid Children?

event.text: You transfer the Orchid children to your cargo hold before finishing the salvage operation.

choice.text: Finish salvaging the ship and forget about the nursery.

event.text: You ignore the room and salvage the rest of the vessel, those kids will be fine, right?

choice.text: Set up a distress beacon and leave.

event.text: You setup a distress beacon on the wreck and try to remove any evidence of your presence before leaving as quickly as possible.

event.name: DEFEAT_AEA_ACID_ELITE
event.text: You're still not sure if killing Acidic Soldiers counts as murder. Either way, losing an elite vessel like that has to hurt the Acidic Growth.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Acidic ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.text: With the shipyard now undefended you're able to loot anything useful, you find an Acidic upgrade package for your oxygen system.

event.text: These wretches aren't worth fighting. Time to spin up and jump off.

destroyed.text: With the orchids destroyed to move in to salvage what you can of the ship.

deadCrew.text: With the orchids killed and the Acidic Growth avenged, you move in to salvage what you can off of the ship.

deadCrew.text: With their crew dead, you quickly shut off their hacking module and your shields return to normal. You strip the ship.

destroyed.text: You've defeated the Elite Acidic Vessel. However, while you attempt to scrap it, you notice the jailer is trying to flee!.

choice.text: Let them go and finish scrapping the ship.

event.text: You let the jailer ship disappear into the clouds and continue your salvage mission.

choice.text: Abandon the wreckage and chase down the Jailer.

event.text: You follow the Jailer through the nebula until they finally give up and surrender.
It appears they have only a single prisoner on board. A Slug Saboteur, they're grateful.

gotaway.text: The rebels jump away. They'll no doubt relay your position to the rest of the rebellion.

destroyed.text: The rebels have been defeated, It's a good thing you saw through their disguise as a simple civilian vessel, or maybe you're just a monster.

deadCrew.text: The rebels have been defeated, It's a good thing you saw through their disguise as a simple civilian vessel, or maybe you're just a monster.

surrender.text: When the Acidic ship looks ready to break apart you notice the Slug ship has secured the loot and is preparing to jump away!.

event.text: It's best you finish this - but you wonder whether what the Acidic vessel is carrying will be as valuable as what the Slugs snuck off with.

choice.text: Let the Acidic ship escape and go after the Slug ship.

event.text: The Acidic vessel too badly damaged to pursue you, and you catch up to the Slugs before they jump. "Ah, of courssse, we would never leave without providing the agreed upon ssspoils." They transfer over a decent chunk of the profits and set off.

destroyed.text: With the Acidic vessel defeated you scan the debris for anything useful. The Slug ship is long gone, spoils from the cache in hand.

deadCrew.text: With the Acidic vessel defeated you scan the debris for anything useful. The Slug ship is long gone, spoils from the cache in hand.

destroyed.text: With the Acidic vessel taken care of, you search again for the cache it was protecting, but it's lost in the clouds. You console yourself with the salvage from the well-armed ship.

deadCrew.text: With the Acidic vessel defeated, you search again for the cache it was protecting, but it's lost in the clouds. You console yourself with the salvage from the well-armed ship.

surrender.text: "This fight isn't worth it, take the antidote as a trade for peace."

event.text: The Acidic vessel transfers over the antidote, and promptly jumps away. You're hesitant to inject it into your crew, but you have no choice. Luckily, they seem to be getting better already.

destroyed.text: You've destroyed the Acidic ship, but now there's no way to get the antidote back. Your crew is doomed, it seems.

deadCrew.text: You've neutralized the Acidic ship and emptied it of all crew.

event.text: Luckily it appears their labs onboard were not damaged in the fight. You grab the antidote and administer it to your crew.

destroyed.text: You've destroyed the Acidic ship, As you're looting the remains of both the Acidic vessel and the Strange ship destroyed at the start of the fight, you discover an Acidic Soldier alive in the wreck.

deadCrew.text: You've neutralized the Acidic ship and emptied it of all crew. As you're looting the remains of both the Acidic vessel and the Strange ship destroyed at the start of the fight, you discover an Acidic Soldier alive in the wreck.

destroyed.text: You've destroyed the hulking Acidic vessel, as you're searching through the huge wreck created by it's defeat you find an intact databank, and on it the schematics for a ship.

deadCrew.text: You've cleared the hulking Acidic vessel of it's crew, as you're searching through the huge carcass created by it's defeat you find an intact databank, and on it the schematics for a ship.

escape.text: They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.

destroyed.text: You've destroyed the transport, and with it any of the important loot it was carrying.

deadCrew.text: The crew is dead, leaving you with the ship. Its cargo is yours for the taking. Aboard is an unusual barrel, perhaps if you had a weapon without a barrel it would be useful.

choice.text: Install the barrel into the weapon from the shipyard.

event.text: You slot the barrel in and it joins seemlessly with the rest of the weapon.
The weapon is now fully operational.

choice.text: You have no use for the barrel.
